intro: Ahzolia composita, commonly known as the composite bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Ahzolia composita has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
